xxl.core.math

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.math.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends Object
    This class contains some useful static methods for dealing with statistical functions.

    • Method Detail

      • normalQuantil

        public static double normalQuantil(double p)
        Computes the p-quantil (lower tail area) of the standard normal distribution. Based on:
        P.Griffiths, I.D.Hill: Applied Statistics Algorithms: Ellis Horwood Limited: 1985 :p.188 ff. (AS 111).
        Parameters:
        p - quantil to compute
        Returns:
        p-quantil of the N(0,1)-Distribution.

      • doubleArrayCFD

        public static Object[] doubleArrayCFD(Iterator cfd,
                                      Function mapping)
        Converts a cumulative frequency distribution of numerical data into two arrays of types double [] for the data and int [] for the frequencies.
        Parameters:
        cfd - cumulative frequency distribution of numerical data
        mapping - function that maps the data values to an alternative representation
        Returns:
        an Object [] filled with a double [] containing the data and an int [] containing the corresponding frequencies

      • doubleArrayCFD

        public static Object[] doubleArrayCFD(Iterator cfd)
        Converts a cumulative frequency distribution of numerical data into two arrays of types double [] for the data and int [] for the frequencies.
        Parameters:
        cfd - cumulative frequency distribution of numerical data
        Returns:
        an Object [] filled with a double [] containing the data and a int [] containing the corresponding frequencies

      • evalReal1DFunction

        public static double[] evalReal1DFunction(double[] grid,
                                          Function realFunction)
        Evaluates a real-valued function on a given grid of double values. Real-valued function means that the given function consumes objects of type Double and returns Objects of type Number.
        Parameters:
        grid - given data points to evaluate
        realFunction - real-valued function (one dimensional) to evaluate
        Returns:
        a double [] filled with the function values on the grid

      • evalRealFunction

        public static double[] evalRealFunction(double[] grid,
                                        RealFunction f)
        Evaluates a real-valued function on a given grid of double values.
        Parameters:
        grid - given data points to evaluate
        f - function to evaluate
        Returns:
        a double [] filled with the function values on the grid

      • evalReal1DFunction

        public static double[] evalReal1DFunction(double a,
                                          double b,
                                          int n,
                                          Function realFunction)
        Evaluates a given real-valued function on an interval [left,right] with a predefined number of points. Real-valued function means that the given function consumes objects of type Double and returns Objects of type Number.
        Parameters:
        a - left border of the interval to evaluate
        b - right border of the interval to evaluate
        n - number of points to evaluate
        realFunction - real-valued function (one dimensional) to evaluate
        Returns:
        a double [] filled with the function values on the grid

      • evalRealFunction

        public static double[] evalRealFunction(double a,
                                        double b,
                                        int n,
                                        RealFunction f)
        Evaluates a real-valued function on equally spaced, real-valued data points.
        Parameters:
        a - left border of the interval to evaluate
        b - right border of the interval to evaluate
        n - number of points to evaluate
        f - function to evaluate
        Returns:
        double [] filled with the function values on the grid

      • evalReal1DFunctionX

        public static double[] evalReal1DFunctionX(double[] grid,
                                           Function realFunction)
        Evaluates a given real-valued function on a given grid of double values. Real-valued function means that the given function consumes objects of type Double and returns Objects of type Number.
        Parameters:
        grid - given data points to evaluate
        realFunction - real-valued function (one dimensional) to evaluate
        Returns:
        a double [] filled with the evaluated real-valued function points alternately with the data points, meaning the returned array consists of {x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xn-1, yn-1} with f(xi) = yi for all i = 0, ... , n-1

      • evalReal1DFunctionX

        public static double[] evalReal1DFunctionX(double a,
                                           double b,
                                           int n,
                                           Function realFunction)
        Evaluates a given real-valued function on equally spaced real-valued data points. Real-valued function means that the given function consumes objects of type Double and returns Objects of type Number.
        Parameters:
        a - left border of the interval to evaluate
        b - right border of the interval to evaluate
        n - number of points to evaluate
        realFunction - real-valued function (one dimensional) to evaluate
        Returns:
        a double [] filled with the evaluated real-valued function points alternately with the data points, meaning the returned array consists of {x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xn-1, yn-1} with f(xi) = yi for all i = 0, ... , n-1

      • gaussian

        public static double gaussian(double x,
                              double mean,
                              double variance)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the value of the Gaussian probability density function (pdf) at a given point x.
        Parameters:
        x - argument where to evaluate the pdf
        mean - mean of the pdf
        variance - variance of the pdf
        Returns:
        value of the pdf at position x
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if variance < 0

      • gaussian

        public static double gaussian(double x)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the probability density function (pdf) of the standard Gaussian distribution (normal pdf). An expectation value of 0.0 and a variance of 1.0 will be assumed.
        Parameters:
        x - argument where to evaluate the pdf
        Returns:
        value of the pdf at position x
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - invalid argument

      • gaussianPrimitive

        public static double gaussianPrimitive(double x,
                                       int n)
        Returns a numerical approximation of the primitive of the standard Gaussian distribution (normal pdf).
        Parameters:
        argument - where to evaluate the pdf
        n - iteration number for the numerical approximation
        Returns:
        value of the pdf at position x

      • gaussianPrimitive

        public static double gaussianPrimitive(double x)
        Returns a numerical approximation of the primitive of the standard Gaussian distribution (normal pdf).
        Parameters:
        argument - where to evaluate the pdf
        Returns:
        value of the pdf at position x

      • epanechnikow

        public static double epanechnikow(double x)
        Evaluates the Epanechnikow kernel.
        Parameters:
        x - function argument
        Returns:
        f(x) = 0.75 ( 1 - x^2) * I(x)_[-1,1]
        See Also:
        EpanechnikowKernel

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • variance

        public static double variance(Object[] data)
        Returns the variance of a given dataset. The data is assumed to be numerical, i.e. of type Number.
        Parameters:
        data - numerical data
        Returns:
        variance of the data

      • sampleVariance

        public static double sampleVariance(Object[] data)
        Returns the unbiased variance of a given sample. The data is assumed to be numerical ,i.e., of type Number.
        Parameters:
        data - numerical data
        Returns:
        variance of the data

      • average

        public static double average(Object[] data)
        Returns the average of a given dataset. The data is assumed to be numerical i.e. of type Number.
        Parameters:
        data - numerical data
        Returns:
        average of the data

      • getStatistics

        public static Object[] getStatistics(Iterator data)
        Computes different aggregates (statistics) of a given set of data.
        Parameters:
        data - data given as stream containing Objects of type Number
        Returns:
        An Object[] o containing Objects representing the computed statistics as:
        o[0]: number of processed data
        o[1]: minimum of processed data
        o[2]: maximum of processed data
        o[3]: average of processed data
        o[4]: standard deviation of processed data

      • maxDiff

        public static int[] maxDiff(Iterator data,
                            Distance distance,
                            int n,
                            boolean noZero)
        This method computes the n maximum differences in the given data. To do so, a distance must be defined for the data. For example, the cumulative frequency distribution could be used with a difference function defined as the differences of the frequencies of the data points.
        Parameters:
        data - data used to compute the max-diff-positions
        distance - distance function used for determining the n biggest differences
        n - number of differences to find
        noZero - indicates whether the distance of two objects which is equal to zero is allowed
        Returns:
        the indices (positions where the data occurred in the iterator) of the n biggest differences according to the given distance function, starting with the (left) index of the n-th biggest difference and ending with the biggest one
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of differences doesn't match the number of given data ( n too big or too less data)
